briefdescription.para: JSON parse error or missing required fields.
Binary path unspecified and could not be inferred.
Status codes for I/O helpers and lightweight subsystems.

detaileddescription.para: Negative values indicate failure categories that are stable enough for diagnostics in the CLI/harness. Implementations may additionally set errno for OS-level failures (open/stat/read), but errno is not required for every IE_IO_ERR_* return code.

briefdescription.para: Open and parse IEBIN v1 metadata and resolve the weights path.

detaileddescription.para:
On success:
out->loaded is non-zero,
out->json_path and out->weights_path are filled with resolved paths,
out->bin_size_bytes reflects the weights binary size,
out->dtype carries the declared precision/dtype for diagnostics.

On failure:
a negative ie_io_status_t is returned,
out is left in a safe-to-close state (implementations should either memset to zero or ensure ie_weights_close() is idempotent).

json_path
Path to model.ie.json (readable).
bin_path
Optional override for model.ie.bin; may be NULL.
out
Output descriptor (written on success).
IE_IO_OK on success, negative ie_io_status_t otherwise.
Populates the public descriptor with:
version (defaults to 1 if missing),
dtype (defaults to "float32"),
resolved weights_path,
bin_size_bytes,
loaded flag set on success.
If dedup fields are present and IE_WEIGHTS_HAS_DEDUP_FIELDS==1, also tries to open dedup artifacts and stores the opaque handle.

simplesect.para: IE_IO_OK on success; IE_IO_ERR_* on failure.

briefdescription.para: Touch the weights binary to verify readability (optional warm-up).

detaileddescription.para: Implementations typically perform a fast sequential or page-stride read to force the OS to fault pages into memory and catch permission/corruption issues early. This function should be safe to call multiple times.

w
Opened descriptor.
IE_IO_OK on success, negative ie_io_status_t otherwise.
Touch the weights binary to verify readability (optional warm-up).

Performs small positional reads near the start and end if the file is large. If IE_DEDUP=1, also touches model.dedup.json and the default/exception/mask bins in the same directory as model.ie.json. If IE_DEDUP_STRICT=1, missing artifacts cause failure.

simplesect.para: IE_IO_OK on success, IE_IO_ERR_* on error.

briefdescription.para: Close weights resources and release optional dedup handle.

detaileddescription.para: This function must be idempotent: calling it on a zeroed or partially-opened descriptor must be safe.

w
Descriptor to close (may be NULL).
Close weights resources and release optional dedup handle.

briefdescription.para: Load a vocabulary from vocab_path or fall back to a stub.

detaileddescription.para: If vocab_path is NULL, the implementation may fall back to a simple stub vocabulary suitable for tests and the benchmark harness.

vocab_path
Path to vocab file; may be NULL.
out
Output vocab.
0 on success, negative on unrecoverable failure.
Load a vocabulary from vocab_path or fall back to a stub.

The implementation accepts any readable file but only attempts to detect a simple JSON-like "vocabSize": <int> field. If the file is missing or unparsable, a small stub vocab is returned to keep execution deterministic.

parameterdescription.para: Path to a vocabulary file (may be NULL).
on invalid arguments (e.g., out is NULL).

briefdescription.para: Encode UTF-8 text into token IDs (whitespace split, hashed IDs).

detaileddescription.para: This is a stub tokenizer intended for harness/testing. It is not meant to be compatible with a production BPE. The goal is stable behavior across runs.

Size-only mode:
Pass ids==NULL to compute required token count in *out_count.

v
Vocabulary descriptor.
text
NUL-terminated UTF-8 input.
ids
Output buffer or NULL for size query.
out_count
In: capacity; Out: tokens written/needed.
0 on success, negative on error.
Encode UTF-8 text into token IDs (whitespace split, hashed IDs).
Tokenization rule: split on one or more whitespace characters (ASCII). Consecutive whitespace collapses to a single separator, producing no empty tokens. For example, "hello world" yields 2 tokens.
Size-only mode: pass ids == NULL to receive the required length in *out_count without writing IDs.

parameterdescription.para: Loaded vocabulary descriptor (only vocab_size is used).
NUL-terminated UTF-8 string. Must not be NULL.
Output buffer of length *out_count (or NULL for size query).
In: capacity of ids when ids != NULL. Out: number of tokens written (or needed).
if provided capacity is insufficient to hold all tokens.

memberdef.argsstring: (const ie_vocab_t *v, const uint32_t *ids, uint32_t count, char *out, size_t out_sz)
memberdef.name: ie_tok_decode

briefdescription.para: Decode token IDs into a printable placeholder string.

detaileddescription.para: This function exists for tests and diagnostic tooling. It does not attempt to reconstruct original text; it only provides a stable printable form.

v
Vocabulary descriptor.
ids
Token IDs.
count
Number of IDs.
out
Output buffer.
out_sz
Output buffer capacity in bytes.
0 on success, negative on error.
Decode token IDs into a printable placeholder string.
Format: "T<ID0> T<ID1> ... T<IDn>" (space-separated). This is sufficient for unit-test invariants that check spacing and a predictable prefix.

parameterdescription.para: Output buffer for the textual form.
on invalid arguments (e.g., NULL out or zero out_sz).
if out is too small to hold the formatted string.

detaileddescription.para: Present for API symmetry; implementations may later allocate resources.
